name: (2E)-1,3-benzothiazol-2-yl[(4-chlorophenyl)hydrazono]ethanenitrile
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1084
Reason: 1,3-Benzothiazole base has a melting point around 106°C. The presence of two phenyl groups and one chlorine atom increases the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, which can raise it by approximately +10°C each. The hydrazono group introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +70°C. The chlorine atom introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. The thiazole ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +30°C. Summing up these changes: Benzothiazole base (+106°C), two phenyl groups (+20°C), one chlorine atom (+50°C), and one hydrazono group (+70°C).
